| I. PRELIMINARY | Defines the short title, extent, commencement, and key terms used throughout the Act. |

| V. INCOME OF OTHER PERSONS, INCLUDED IN ASSESSEE'S TOTAL INCOME | Provisions related to the inclusion of income of other persons, such as spouses, minor children, and revocable or irrevocable transfers, in the total income of the assessee. Related sections: 60, 64. |
| VI. AGGREGATION OF INCOME AND SET OFF OR CARRY FORWARD OF LOSS | Rules for aggregating income from various sources, set off and carry forward of losses, and provisions related to cash credits, unexplained investments, and expenditures. Related sections: 68, 69, 70, 71, 72. |

| VIII. REBATES AND RELIEFS | Rebates and reliefs available for computing income tax, such as rebates for securities transaction tax and relief when salary is paid in arrears or in advance. |
| IX. DOUBLE TAXATION RELIEF | Provisions related to relief from double taxation through agreements with foreign countries or specified territories. |
| X. SPECIAL PROVISIONS RELATING TO AVOIDANCE OF TAX | Rules for computing arm's length prices for international transactions, avoidance of tax through certain transactions, and the general anti-avoidance rule (GAAR). Related sections: 92, 93, 94. |
| XI. PENALTIES IMPOSABLE | Provisions related to penalties for various offenses, such as failure to furnish returns, concealment of income, and failure to comply with notices or provisions. Related sections: 270A, 271, 271A, 271B. |
| XII. DETERMINATION OF TAX IN CERTAIN SPECIAL CASES | Rules for determining tax in specific cases, such as accumulated balance of recognized provident funds, short-term and long-term capital gains, income of foreign companies, and winnings from lotteries or gambling. Related sections: 111A, 112, 115A, 115B. |
| XII-A. SPECIAL PROVISIONS RELATING TO CERTAIN INCOMES OF NON-RESIDENTS | Provisions related to the computation of total income and taxation of certain incomes of non-residents. |
| XII-B. SPECIAL PROVISIONS RELATING TO CERTAIN COMPANIES | Rules for the determination of deemed income and tax credit for certain companies. |
| XII-BA. SPECIAL PROVISIONS RELATING TO CERTAIN PERSONS OTHER THAN A COMPANY | Provisions related to the payment of alternate minimum tax by certain persons other than companies. |
| XII-BB. SPECIAL PROVISIONS RELATING TO CONVERSION OF INDIAN BRANCH OF A FOREIGN BANK INTO A SUBSIDIARY COMPANY | Rules for the conversion of an Indian branch of a foreign bank into a subsidiary company. |

| XII-C. SPECIAL PROVISIONS RELATING TO RETAIL TRADE, ETC. | No sections listed. |

| XII-DA. SPECIAL PROVISIONS RELATING TO TAX ON DISTRIBUTED INCOME OF DOMESTIC COMPANY FOR BUY-BACK OF SHARES | Provisions related to the tax on distributed income of domestic companies for the buy-back of shares. Related sections: 115QA, 115QB, 115QC. |

| XII-FA. SPECIAL PROVISIONS RELATING TO BUSINESS TRUSTS | Provisions related to the taxation of business trusts. |
| XII-FB. SPECIAL PROVISIONS RELATING TO TAX ON INCOME OF INVESTMENT FUNDS AND INCOME RECEIVED FROM SUCH FUNDS | Provisions related to the tax on income of investment funds and income received from such funds. |

| XII-H. INCOME-TAX OF FRINGE BENEFITS | Provisions related to the charge of fringe benefit tax, valuation of fringe benefits, and procedures for filing returns and assessments. |

| XIX-B. ADVANCE RULINGS | Provisions related to advance rulings by the Authority for Advance Rulings. Related sections: 245N, 245-O, 245Q, 245R, 245S. |
| XX. APPEALS AND REVISION | Provisions related to appeals to various income tax authorities, such as the Deputy Commissioner (Appeals), Commissioner (Appeals), Appellate Tribunal, High Court, and Supreme Court, as well as revision of orders by the Principal Commissioner or Commissioner. Related sections: 246, 246A, 252, 253, 256, 260A, 261, 263, 264. |
| XXI. PENALTIES IMPOSABLE | Provisions related to various penalties imposable for offenses such as under-reporting and misreporting of income, failure to furnish returns or comply with notices, concealment of income, and failure to maintain accounts or documents. Related sections: 270A, 271, 271A, 271B, 271BA. |
| XXII. OFFENCES AND PROSECUTIONS | Provisions related to offenses and prosecutions for various acts, such as willful attempt to evade tax, falsification of books of accounts, abetment of false returns, and offenses by companies or Hindu undivided families. Related sections: 275A, 275B, 276, 276A, 276B, 276C, 277, 278. |
| XXIII. MISCELLANEOUS | Miscellaneous provisions, including provisions related to the service of notices, authentication of documents, publication of information, appearance by authorized representatives, rounding off of income and amounts payable, and the power to tender immunity from prosecution. Related sections: 281B, 285, 285A, 286, 287A, 288, 292C, 292CC, 293. |
